abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Animal Health
            Services Rehabilitation Project is the rehabilitation of
            Kenya's animal health services, and the provision of a
            viable and sustainable institutional framework for animal
            health services which can be maintained over the long-term.
            The project will also aim to introduce gradually full cost
            recovery for animal health services over the life of the
            project.  The project will provide support to:  (i) develop
            specific management systems for the Department of Veterinary
            Services, and (ii) train the staff of the Department of
            Veterinary Services to apply the newly designed management
            systems.  In addition, it will (iii) support disease and
            pest control activities; (iv) rehabilitate veterinary
            laboraties and support livestock disease surveillance
            activities.  Finally, the proposed project will support (v)
            the National Tick Control Program; (vi) clinical services;
            and (vii) pilot trials for developing cheaper methods of
            control of tsetse flies and ticks.  The project will benefit
            pastoralists and smallholders who own 90 percent of the
            livestock of Kenya.
